title: Microscopic Detection of ASC Inflammasomes in Bone Marrow Derived Macrophages Post Stimulation
procedures: Culture of Francisella novicida (U112 strain) and Salmonella Typhimurium (SL1344 strain)Francisella novicida (U112)Recovery of Francisella novicida: Streak the frozen Francisella novicida stock onto TSB solid media (with 1% L-acetylcysteine) and place in a 37°C incubator for 24 h.Culture of Francisella novicida: Place a single colony of Francisella novicida into 5 ml TSB liquid media (with 1% L-acetylcysteine) and grow in 37°C shaker with 200 rpm rotation overnight.Subculture of Francisella novicida: Transfer 3 ml of overnight cultured Francisella novicida into 6 ml fresh TSB liquid media (with 1% L-acetylcysteine) and incubate at 37°C while shaking at 200 rpm for 2 h.Measurement of the concentration of bacteria: Use 1 ml of subcultured Francisella novicida to measure the value of OD600 with the Nanophotometer p-class (IMPLEN, NT80) and calculate the concentration of bacteria according this equation “1 (OD600)=1 × 106 CFU/μl”.Salmonella Typhimurium (SL1344)Recovery of Salmonella Typhimurium: Streak the frozen Salmonella Typhimurium stock onto LB solid media and place in a 37°C incubator for 24 h.Culture of Salmonella Typhimurium: Place a single colony of Salmonella Typhimurium into 3 ml LB liquid media and grow in 37°C shaker with 200 rpm rotation overnight.Subculture of Salmonella Typhimurium: Transfer 0.5 ml of overnight cultured Salmonella Typhimurium into 2.5 ml fresh LB liquid media and incubate at 37°C while shaking at 200 rpm for 2 h.Measurement of the concentration of bacteria: Use 1 ml of subcultured Salmonella Typhimurium to measure the value of OD600 with the Nanophotometer p-class (IMPLEN, NT80) and calculate the concentration of bacteria according to this equation “1 (OD600)=1 × 106 CFU/μl”.Preparation of L929 supernatantSeed 5 × 105 L929 cells in 10 cm Petri dish.Culture L929 cells in the incubator (37°C, 5% CO2) for 7 days in RPMI 1640 media supplemented with 10% FBS.

Collect the supernatant with a pipette into a 50 ml centrifuge tube.Centrifuge at 1,962 × g for 10 min and then transfer the supernatant with a pipette into a new 50 ml centrifuge tube. Freeze at -80°C.Generation of BMDMSSacrifice the mice and spray 75% alcohol on their whole body. Remove the skin and fur from the hind legs and cut off the hind legs after the hip joint. Place in PBS.Remove the muscle tissue from the legs and cut off both ends from the tibia and femur (Video 1).

Video 1. Generation of BMDMs. (This video was made at the Kunming Institute of Zoology according to guidelines from the Kunming Institute of Zoology on Animal Care and was approved by the Animal Research Ethics Board of the Kunming Institute of Zoology under protocol SMKX-20,6020.)Flush the bone marrow (BM) cells with L929 supernatant-containing DMEM/F-12 media (1:3) supplemented with 10% FBS, 1% nonessential amino acids, and 1% penicillin-streptomycin using a 5 ml syringe with a 26 G needle. Aspirate the flushed bone marrow several times through a 20 ml syringe with an 18 G needle to obtain a single cell suspension.Culture BM cells in the incubator (37°C, 5% CO2) for 5 days. Use 10 ml media for each Petri dish and add 5 ml of fresh L929 supernatant-containing DMEM/F-12 media to the Petri dish on day 3.Preparation of cell slidesPlace autoclaved cover slips on a 12-well plate.Wash three times with PBS, for 3 mins each time.Scrape the cells from the culture dish with a cell scraper, resuspend in 10 ml DMEM/F-12 media with 10% FBS, and count cells using a cell counting chamber.Seed 5 × 105 BMDMs into 12-well plates and incubate at 37°C and 5% CO2 overnight. Make sure the cell confluency the next day is around 60%.

Cell stimulation and fixationChange media with 500 μl of fresh DMEM/F-12 media without L929 supernatant before treatment.Treat BMDMs with different conditions, as follows, and incubate at 37°C and 5% CO2.Stimulate BMDMs with 2 μl of LPS (500 ng/ml, 4 h) and 2 μl of ATP (5 mM, 20 min).Transfect BMDMs with dsDNA (2 μl of 1.5 μg vector control plasmid) using the X-fect transfection reagent (X-fect polymer 0.45 μl and X-fect buffer 100 μl) for 15 min.Infect BMDMs with10 μl of Francisella novicida U112 strain (100 MOI, 12 h).Infect BMDMs with10 μl of Salmonella Typhimurium (3 MOI, 1 h).Remove medium by suction from each well and wash three times by gently swirling with PBS.Remove PBS by suction and fix with commercial 4% paraformaldehyde for 15 min at RT.Remove paraformaldehyde by suction and wash the fixed BMDMs on the cover slip by gently swirling with 500 µl PBS three times.Immunofluorescence stainingBlock and permeabilize the cells in 250-300 µl 1% BSA with 0.1% saponin at 15-25°C (RT) for 1 h.Remove block buffer by suction and gentle swirling of the cells with PBS three times for 3 min each time.Incubate the cells in 300 µl primary antibody solution (anti-ASC in 1% BSA, 0.1% saponin, 1:150 dilution) at 4°C overnight.Wash the cells three times with 500 µl 0.1% PBST on a rocking platform, for 3 min each time.Stain the cells with fluorescence conjugated secondary antibody in PBS (1:300 dilution) at 15-25°C (RT) for 1 h.Wash the cells three times with 500 µl 0.1% PBST on a rocking platform, for 3 min each time.Stain the cells with 250-300 µl DAPI (5 μg/ml, prepared in PBS) at 15-25°C (RT) for 5-10 min.Wash the cells three times with 0.1% PBST on a rocking platform, for 3 min each time.

Immobilization of cover slipRemove the cover slip from the 12-well plate with tweezers and air dry.Drop anti-fluorescence attenuation sealant into the cell-containing side.Attach the cell-containing side of the cover slip to microscope slides (25 × 75 mm). Drop sealant onto the edge of the cover slip to bind the cover slip and microscope slide together and prevent sample drying. Avoid air bubbles and air dry for 10 min at 15-25°C (RT).Confocal scanning and image acquisitionScan cells on the ZEISS-LSM880 confocal microscope (100×, the oil-immersion lens).Perform the examination with the ZEISS-LSM880 confocal laser scanning microscope using the following settings: excitation 488 nm and emission 530 nm for ASC speck detection, normal scanning speed, and frame 1024 × 1024. The ASC speck formation was detected and illustrated in Figure 1. Image acquisition was performed with the software ZEN black_2-3SP1.Analyze the data by using the software ZEN blue 2.6 (Protocol in supplementary material[href=https://os.bio-protocol.org/attached/file/20210629/Supplementary file ZEN 3.2 (blue edition) Software Manual.pdf]).
